# Major Violations

This is the section on major violations.

## Prepare Data

```{r mav-prepare-data}
model_seed <- 20230322

create_major_violations_data <- function(data) {
  list(
    major_violations_kloc_std=scale(data$major_violations_kloc),
                    stars_std=scale(data$stars),
             contributors_std=scale(data$contributors),
                      age_std=scale(get_age(data$created_at)),
                     size_std=scale(data$loc),
                    files_std=scale(data$files)
  )
}

data <- create_major_violations_data(df)
data$category <- factor(df$category)

data_factor_uses_warnings <- create_major_violations_data(df)
data_factor_uses_warnings$category <- factor(uses_warnings(df$category))
```

### MAV1 

```{r mav-model-1, message=FALSE}
mav1 <- fit_model(
  "mav1",
  "major_violations_kloc_std ~ 0 + category",
  c(
    prior(normal(0, 1), class = b),
    prior(exponential(1), class = sigma)
  ),
  data,
  model_seed
)

mav1 <- add_criterion(mav1, criterion="loo", moment_match=FALSE)
summary(mav1)
```

### MAV2

```{r mav-model-2, message=FALSE}
fit_model_mav2 <- function(name, data) {
  mav2 <- fit_model(
    name,
    "major_violations_kloc_std ~ 0 + category + contributors_std",
    c(
      prior(normal(0, 1), class=b),
      prior(normal(0, 1), class=b, coef="contributors_std"),
      prior(exponential(1), class=sigma)
    ),
    data,
    model_seed
  )
}

mav2 <- fit_model_mav2("mav2", data)
mav2 <- add_criterion(mav2, criterion = "loo", moment_match = FALSE)
summary(mav2)
```

## Intervals of major categories

```{r mav-plot-intervals-of-major-categories, fig.width=6, fig.height=2.8, message=FALSE}
plot_intervals_of_major_categories(mav2) +
  labs(title="MAV2", x="Major violations per KLOC (std)")
```

## Warnings versus no warnings

```{r mav-warnings-vs-no-warnings, fig.width=6, fig.height=2, message=FALSE}
# Fit MAV2 using data that uses binary factor for usage of warnings
mav2_factor_uses_warnings <- fit_model_mav2(
  "mav2_factor_uses_warnings",
  data_factor_uses_warnings
)

plot_intervals_of_categories(mav2_factor_uses_warnings) +
  labs(title="MAV2", x="Major Violations per KLOC (std)") +
  scale_y_discrete(labels = c(
    "b_category1"="No warnings",
    "b_category2"="Any warnings"
  ))
```

## Without outliers

The sample population has a considerate outlier (clipp), in category AEP.
This is enhanced due to the small size of the clipp project (only 9,000 LOC).

```{r mav-remove-outliers, message=FALSE}
# Prepare version of data frame without the outliers
df_no_outliers <- df
df_no_outliers <- df_no_outliers[df_no_outliers$name != "clipp", ]

# Prepare data for analysis
data_no_outliers <- create_major_violations_data(df_no_outliers)
data_no_outliers$category <- factor(df_no_outliers$category)

# Fit MAV2 using the trimmed data
mav2_no_outliers <- fit_model_mav2("mav2_no_outliers", data_no_outliers)
summary(mav2_no_outliers)
```

```{r mav2-plot-intervals-no-outliers, fig.width=6, fig.height=2.8, message=FALSE}
plot_intervals_of_major_categories(mav2_no_outliers) +
  labs(title="MAV2 (no outliers)", x="Major violations per KLOC (std)")
```

```{r mav-plot-intervals-factor-uses-warnings-no-outliers, fig.width=6, fig.height=2, message=FALSE}
data_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings <- create_major_violations_data(df_no_outliers)
data_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings$category <- factor(uses_warnings(df_no_outliers$category))

# Fit MAV2 using the trimmed data, but with binary warning category factor
mav2_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings <- fit_model_mav2(
  "mav2_data_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings",
  data_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings
)

plot_intervals_of_categories(mav2_no_outliers_factor_uses_warnings) +
  labs(title="MAV2 (no outliers)", x="Major violations per KLOC (std)") +
  scale_y_discrete(labels=c(
    "b_category1"="No warnings",
    "b_category2"="Any warnings"
  ))
```
